result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua A Hamre was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joshua A Hamre is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joshua A Hamre was found guilty of Contact after Domestic Abuse Arrest [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 968.075(5)(a)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Time to Pay Summary mailed to Defendant

(Cases called at 3:10 PM - 22CF28, 22CF122, 22CM30, 22CM123)
Defendant Kyle Hamre appears with Attorney Alicia Linzmeier.  Attorney Afton Lewis appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties stipulate to the competency report finding that the Defendant is competent to proceed.  Dr. Harlan Heinz appears via videoconference and is excused from the hearing.  Court finds the Defendant is competent to proceed.  Defense outlines agreement for the Court.  Defendant advised of the elements, as well as the maximum possible penalties of the offenses to which he will plead.  Defendant pleads No Contest to 22CF28 Count 2: Contact After Domestic Abuse Arrest (Domestic Abuse), and 22CF122 Count 1 as amended to: Misdemeanor Resisting an Officer/Failure to Stop Vehicle - 346.04(2t).  Defendant acknowledges Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form.  Court accepts pleas and finds Defendant guilty of the offenses to which he has pled.  Court withholds sentence and orders 2 years probation with the following conditions: No acts or threats of violence against anyone.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  No possession of any illegal drugs or non-prescribed medications.  Complete a domestic violence assessment and follow through with recommendations.  Complete a mental health assessment and follow through with recommendations.  Comply with any conditions/programming per agent.  Pay court costs, DNA sample surcharge and domestic abuse surcharge.  100 days sentence credit if revoked from probation in 22CF28, and 97 days sentence credit in 22CF122.
Defense requests expungement of the two cases if probation is successfully completed.  State objects.  Court will not order expungement today as it was not part of the agreement of the parties.  Remaining charges, as well as all of 22CM30 and 22CM123, are dismissed and read in.
Competency hearing on July 14, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

(10:00 AM cases 22CM30, 22CM123, 22CF28, 22CF122 called.) Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Joshua A Hamre in court. Attorney Alicia Linzmeier in court for Joshua A Hamre.
Attorney Lewis advises did reach out to the doctors who advised would be unavailable for today's hearing.
State requests the Court extend for good cause and requests the competency hearing be rescheduled.
Attorney Linzmeier agrees with the request to reschedule and advises parties are working on a possible NGI resolution.
Court advises given the information regarding witnesses, Court requests the parties to coordinate with the witnesses and schedule a Competency Hearing with the Branch 2 Judicial Assistant.

Conditions:
No contact with Mega Holiday Stores or Auto Value.
No acts or threats of violence against anyone.
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level. 
(Covers 22CF28, 22CF122, 22CM30, 22CM123)

Attorney Alicia Linzmeier in court for Joshua A Hamre. Victim/Witness statute complied with. Bond is modified to a $500 cash bond. There are contested opinions as to competency and parties may need an evidentiary hearing. Court finds good cause to extend time limits for holding a competency hearing due to witness unavailability. 
Parties advise there are having a pretrial conference on Thursday. 
A Competency hearing is scheduled for 6/9/22 at 10:00 AM (30 min, in person, witnesses permitted to appear via Zoom).

Cases called at 10:53 AM: 22CF28, 22CF122, 22CM30, 22CM123.
Defendant Joshua A Hamre in custody and in court with Attorney Alicia Linzmeier.  Attorney Afton Brianna Lewis in court for State of Wisconsin.   
Defense filed Motion to Modify Bond the Cash Bond to a Signature Bond. 
Attorney Linzmeier notes the second competency examination has been completed, the Defendant is now taking his prescribed medications and is unable to post the $2500 Cash. Victim C.Y. is present and makes a statement requesting the no contact be lifted. 
State opposes any modifications to the bond as the Defendant has previously missed court and is facing serious charges.
State defers to the Court regarding lifting the no contact with C.Y. 
Court denies the motion to modify the bond to a Signature Bond, but grants the request no remove the No contact with C.Y.  and her residence, providing she cooperates with Victim Witness.
Competency Hearing: 5/11/22 at 10:30 AM.

11:20am Cases called: 22CF122, 22CF28, 22CM30 & 22CM123. Defendant Joshua Hamre appeared in custody via video from the Eau Claire County jail with Attorney Sonia Anderson. Attorney Matthew Kirkpatrick appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Warrant executed in 22CF28 & 22CM30. Defendant waives reading of the complaint in 22CF122 & 22CM123. Court finds good cause to extend time limits for preliminary hearing. Attorney Anderson requests a Competency Evaluation. There is an evaluation currently being done in Trempealeau County with a Competency Hearing on 02/23/22. Court sets bond and orders a Competency Evaluation be completed. Cases referred to Br. 2 for scheduling a Competency Hearing.

Conditions:
No contact with C.Y. or C.Y. residence.
No contact with Mega Holiday stores or Auto Value.
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level. 
(Covers 22CF28, 22CF122, 22CM30, 22CM123)

Defendant Joshua A Hamre not in court, Attorney Alicia Linzmeier appeared in court for Joshua A Hamre, Attorney Monica Fallon appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Linzmeier indicates that the Defendant was in custody in Trempealeau County and may have posted bond but she does not have good contact information for him.
Defense previously raised competency at the Preliminary Hearing but an evaluation was not ordered. 
State requests warrants. Warrants ordered.
Hearing on February 3, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

(Cases 22CF28, 22CM30 are called at 2:30 PM) Defendant Joshua A Hamre appeared by video, from Trempealeau County Jail, Attorney Alicia Linzmeier appeared in court for Joshua A Hamre, Attorney Afton Brianna Lewis Ms. appeared in court for State of Wisconsin.  
State moves to dismiss Count 1 in 22CF28. Defendant objects. Defense raises competency concerns. Court grants State's motion to dismiss Count 1 in 22CF28. 
Further scheduling with Branch 2 Judicial Assistant.
